summary:
Lyme disease is caused by bacteria spread through tick bites. It often starts with a red rash and flu-like symptoms. If not treated early, it can lead to serious issues like facial paralysis and joint pain.

Prevention includes wearing long clothes and using insect repellents. Removing ticks quickly reduces the risk of infection. Antibiotics are used to treat the disease.

Lyme disease is common in the Northern Hemisphere, especially in warm months. It was first recognized in 1975 and is being studied for better treatment and a potential vaccine.
title: Lyme disease
